posts.name: Barista Parlor x Germantown
posts.note: Barista Parlor x Germantown is a hip coffeehouse serves artisanal espresso and local, seasonal cafe eats in an open, industrial venue. From their website, 'Barista Parlor was established in 2011. We seek the betterment of coffee in all forms, with an emphasis on ethics in sourcing and sweetness in roasting. Our coffee is brewed with a focus on framing both of these qualities not only in a beautiful cup but in a physical space where commerce and art intersect. We work with local Nashville artists, farms, businesses, and bakeries.' Spotted this place walking by during a food and history tour of Germantown area. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Betty's Grill
posts.note: Betty's Grill is a mellow, cash-only and smoker-friendly neighborhood haunt with pub grub, live bands, pool, and beer.

posts.name: Big Bad Breakfast
posts.note: From Big Bad Breakfast's website, 'Get ready Nashville…we’re bringing a breakfast menu with more than a few surprises and food full of inspiration and energy. One visit, and you’ll never look at a breakfast plate the same again. Whether it’s our house-cured Tabasco Brown Sugar Bacon, crispy southern fried chicken, Original Grit Girl grits, or the Anson Mills Steel Cut Oatmeal, you’ll be talking about coming back before you’ve left the table. And don’t forget… we serve lunch too.' My friend Chris Harrison recommends 'The Mother of All Biscuits', which is a crispy-fried dill chicken breast and cheddar cheese on a buttermilk biscuit.

posts.name: Bolton’s Spicy Chicken and Fish
posts.note: Bolton’s Spicy Chicken and Fish is a local fast-food chain serving spicy chicken, plus ribs, fish, and Southern sides, in a no-frills space. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Butchertown Hall
posts.note: From their website, 'Butchertown Hall is local restaurateur Terry Raley’s vision of modern barbeque, inspired by the Central Texas meat market culture in which he grew up, and the late 19th-century butcher shop pursuits of this very neighborhood. Making extensive use of our 36 square-foot open fire hearth, alongside a custom-built high-capacity smoker, we patiently cook soulful, exciting food. Expect the finest wood-fired premium cuts, craft tacos, and Tex-Mex standards, roasted oysters, delicately-charred garden vegetables, and the finest smoked brisket outside of Austin…ask around.' As part of a food and history walking tour of the Germantown area of Nashville, we stopped in for their 23-hour smoked brisket with housemade pickles, thinly sliced onions, and sauces in homemade tortilla shells.

posts.name: The Catbird Seat
posts.note: The Catbird Seat is a buzzy, upscale new American mecca serving a changing tasting menu in a U-shaped open kitchen. From the World's 50 Best website, 'A cube-shaped marble counter in an otherwise bare room ensures all eyes are kept on the performance occurring in the open kitchen at the center. And what a performance it is. Head chef Will Aghajanian and pastry chef Liz Johnson, who took the helm in early 2019, first met in the hallowed kitchens of Noma. Their 12-course tasting menus are equally obsessed with creating a sense of place. Expect playful plates such as duck tartare scattered with cashew and rose essence, bay scallop with rambutan (an Indonesian fruit) and pungent horseradish, baked potato aligot with juniper resin and, for dessert, dark roux ice cream.'

posts.name: Christie Cookie Co.
posts.note: Christie Cookie Co. old-school bakery providing homestyle cookies for in-store purchase and gift sets by web/mail-order. They make all the cookies for the DoubleTree Hotel chain. From their website, 'While Music City sleeps through early morning hours, we cross the doorframe to our own little piece of Nashville authenticity - the Christie Cookie bakery. Each batch is handcrafted by folks who understand the importance of originality. The scent of real butter baking in our warm ovens is unmistakable. We’ve held fast to the integrity of gourmet ingredients, refusing to sacrifice quality instead of shortcuts or artificial substitutes.'

posts.name: The Cupcake Collection
posts.note: The Cupcake Collection is a specialty cupcake shop with a variety of creative flavors, which are the draw at this local, cheerful bakeshop. The Cupcake Collection has been voted the number one cupcake in Nashville and eight nationwide. So as you would expect, they make a great cupcake. We stopped here on a food and history tour of the Germantown area of Nashville. If you get a chance, you should order there Sweat Potato cupcake.

posts.name: Dandgure's Classic Southern Cooking
posts.note: Dandgure's Classic Southern Cooking is a long-standing cafeteria-style establishment providing Southern lunch staples in down-home surrounds.

posts.name: Dino's Bar
posts.note: Dino's Bar is an old-school operation serving up straightforward burgers, fries, and beer in an easygoing setting. From their website, 'As East Nashville’s oldest dive bar, Dino’s stays true to its roots. Serving classic burgers and fries, Dino’s is a neighborhood watering hole for locals and visitors alike. Dino’s is fine food and cold beer. Known across the country for the “Dino’s cheeseburger”.'

posts.name: Fox's Donut Den
posts.note: Fox's Donut Den is an old-fashioned institution turning out classic donuts and pastries since 1973, plus they have bagels and coffee.

posts.name: The Grilled Cheeserie
posts.note: The Grilled Cheeserie is a popular food truck is serving up artisanal grilled cheese sandwiches and seasonal bites at the counter. You need to order the pimento cheese grilled mac and cheese.

posts.name: Hathorne
posts.note: From the Hathorne website, 'Chef John Stephenson’s culinary viewpoint is ‘new American;’ the ingredients and recipes he’s put together are inspired by his surroundings in the South, yet influenced by the ethnic threads that are woven into American culture, as well as John’s travels. Our menu features familiar ingredients and cooking methods, but they’re presented in special and unexpected ways featuring big flavors full of vibrant colors that celebrate the best of the season.'

posts.name: Hattie B's Hot Chicken
posts.note: Hattie B‘s Hot Chicken serves mild to very spicy fried chicken, Southern sides, and local brews in a casual, counter-service eatery.

posts.name: Husk
posts.note: Husk serves regional ingredients cooked on an ember-fired grill creates inventive meals in a historic mansion. From the Husk website, 'At Husk, there are some rules about what can go on the plate. If it doesn’t come from the South, it’s not coming through the door. The resulting cuisine is not about rediscovering Southern cooking, but rather exploring the reality of Southern food. Seed-saving, heirloom husbandry, in-house pickling, and charcuterie programs by Executive Chef Katie Coss and her culinary team are the basis of Husk’s cuisine.' While I was there, I ordered four appetizers instead of one and a meal so I could taste more items. I order the Pimento Cheese with Benne Wafers, 12-month aged Benton’s ham with cheddar biscuits and pickled green tomatoes, brined and smoked chicken wings with a spicy sauce, and a bowl of cheesy grits and uncooked shrimp which cooked as they sat in the hot grits. Reminder: The menu changes daily.

posts.name: King Market
posts.note: King Market is a market featuring Asian groceries and a casual Thai-Laotian cafe serving Pho, Pad Thai, Loa food, curries, and beer.

posts.name: Martin’s Bar-B-Que Joint
posts.note: Martin’s Bar-B-Que Joint has a pit for cooking whole pigs which dominates the homey dining room at this popular BBQ emporium. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Mas Tacos Por Favor
posts.note: Mas Tacos Por Favor is a snug, no-frills Mexican restaurant fixing up an array of tacos and other standards. You need to order the chicken tamale which is only served on Wednesday's and during the holidays or Pozole Verde Soup or the sweet potato and quinoa tacos.

posts.name: Pastaria
posts.note: Pastaria serves updated Italian cooking in a slick, modern trattoria with a soaring ceiling, and an open kitchen. From the Nashville Scene website, 'Tender chicken thighs were cooked over an open flame and dressed in a fiery Piri-Piri chili sauce, then placed on squishy buns and topped with crunchy dill pickles. It was the perfect balance of smoke, salt and spice, and in a town that’s drowning in mediocre takes on hot chicken; this one was welcome.'

posts.name: Peg Leg Porker BBQ
posts.note: Peg Leg Porker BBQ serves pulled pork, ribs, fried pies, and buckets of beer on the patio or in the plain but soulful interior. From their website, 'At Peg Leg Porker, we pride ourselves on excellent customer service and great food. Our award-winning BBQ is what makes us stand out above the crowd. Our meats are smoked fresh daily; our delicious sides are made from scratch with love. We use our local bakeries for bread and desserts. It doesn't get any better than this, except maybe your Grandmama’s house. Our southern hospitality is one you won't forget. Remember, we are more than just BBQ. Let us make your special occasion an event people will never forget.' Reminder: If you don't have money for the parking meters, there is a parking garage with the first-hour free parking if there is not a line.

posts.name: Prince's Hot Chicken Shack
posts.note: Prince's Hot Chicken Shack is known for Nashville's unique deep-fried poultry specialty, spiced from mild to ultra hot levels. I went with medium spicy because I figured I could go hotter next time instead of burning my mouth off.

posts.name: Redheaded Stranger
posts.note: From the Redheaded Stranger website, 'We’re a neighborhood taco shop in East Nashville. If you like fresh and delicious tacos, brisket, Hatch green chiles, and other southwestern inspired foods, you’re in the right place.' From the Nashville Eater website, 'The long wait for fresh flour tortillas, tacos, and queso at East Nashville’s new Tex-Mex joint Redheaded Stranger is finally over. Chef Bryan Lee Weaver and restaurateur Michael Shemtov of Butcher and Bee announced that the restaurant, inspired by Weaver’s childhood, spent in Texas...'

posts.name: Rotier's Restaurant
posts.note: Rotier's Restaurant is an old-fashioned bar and grill known for cheeseburgers on French bread and thick milkshakes. It’s a meat and three places that serve great burgers too.

posts.name: Silver Sands Café
posts.note: Silver Sands Café is a family owned restaurant that serves some of the best homemade southern style food in the Downtown Nashville area. Popular family recipes have been passed down three generations now, including smothered pork chops, potatoes, and onions, salmon croquettes, fried chicken, mac and cheese, greens, hot water cornbread, and so much more.

posts.name: Steam Boys
posts.note: From the Steam Boys website, 'It is our great pleasure to finally bring you the wonderful, traditional Chinese comfort food experience Nashville has been waiting for. We are Steam Boys. Your support thus far has been nothing short of exceptional, truly the major motivating factor behind what we believe will elevate the local Asian food scene to new heights. You deserve authentic, delicious, healthy food, and a glimpse into Chinese culture. You deserve to be proud of what Nashville has to offer. What makes Steam Boys special are not just the food and warm environment. At our core is a deep respect for diversity. Our food happens to be Chinese, but it is without exception food to be enjoyed by all.'
posts.rcmmnd: Best Chinese restaurant in every state from MSN website

posts.name: Sun Diner
posts.note: Sun Diner serves classic Southern favorites, and breakfast specialties served 24/7 in a Sun Records–themed diner. When you're there, try their house ketchup, which has more of a sweet BBQ flavor along with their green sauce, which has a bit of a zing. From the Sun Diner website, 'Located in the Heart of Music City beside the Johnny Cash Museum, Sun Diner offers southern hospitality and farm-fresh cuisine day and night. Our specially designed menu compliments the unique interior that celebrates Sun Records’ legendary artists we have recognized for decades. Start with ‘Johnny B Good Flatbread’ or ‘Love Me Tenders’ or try one of the Classics, such as the ‘Million Dollar Quartet,’ your taste buds will not be disappointed!'

posts.name: Tailor Nashville
posts.note: From the Tailor Nashville website, 'Tailor Nashville offers a simple, timeless dining experience that emulates an intimate dinner party in the way it fills both the bodies and souls of its guests. Culinary Creator Vivek Surti honors his heritage through the South Asian American cuisine that is representative of Surti being a first-generation American of Indian descent. At Tailor Nashville, guests are welcomed and enjoy eight to ten dishes that are explained by the chefs with high touch service.'

posts.name: Vui's Kitchen
posts.note: Vui's Kitchen is a Vietnamese stop for pho, banh mi, and noodle bowls, plus drinks, along with indoor/outdoor seating. Saw this place walking by on a food and history tour of the Germantown area of Nashville and had a pretty good-sized crowd for an early lunch. From their website, 'Fresh and flavorful, Vui’s Kitchen offers a range of Vietnamese favorites from Pho noodle soup to our signature Banh Mi sandwich. We only use whole food ingredients, loaded with fresh herbs and love. Nothing is fried, and there’s no MSG - we’re simply real. Vui’s Kitchen opens its third store in 2019. Founded to extend the traditions of Founder Vui Hunt’s family in Vietnam, we hope you experience an authentic community and crave-able food at our table.' NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Waldo's Chicken and Beer
posts.note: From Waldo's Chicken and Beer website, 'We try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are, however, very passionate about great food and great service. Waldo’s is simply all about chicken, and we’re cookin’ it up two delicious ways for you: Southern Fried and Fire-Roasted. You can also enjoy our chicken in a variety of ways: On the Bone, On the Bun, In a Basket, or In a Bowl. Toss in some of our homemade sides, any of our eight original sauces, and signature cheese biscuits, and you’ve found yourself a new favorite chicken spot.' Stopped here on a food and history tour of Germantown area and had their mac and cheese, which was spectacular.
